text: okay so the way that you sense or feel
pain is your body has a pain pathway
which is essentially a series of nerves
and these nerves have tiny little pores
or channels that regulate the movement
of sodium and potassium ions and by
regulating the movement of ions through
the membranes of these nerve fibers you
can create an electrical signal so your
pain pathway takes painful information
from your environment like a scorpion
sting or being burned or cutting
yourself and that information is then
turned into electrical signals which
travel along your nerves towards your
spinal cord and then from the spinal
cord those electrical signals are sent
to your brain where that information is
processed and you actually feel the
sensation of pain
you
